intro: Schizocarpum parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered schizocarp, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant produces schizocarps, which are dry fruits that split into two parts upon maturity. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has finely divided leaves. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
